title: Button Hook Entry to Hide Sites
brief: Use deceptive movement patterns when entering hide sites to avoid leaving obvious trails.
steps: Step 1: Do not move straight into your selected hide site from your approach direction.
Step 2: Use a button hook technique - move past the hide site, then circle back from a different angle.
Step 3: Stop at a position outside the hide site and conduct a listening halt for at least 2-3 minutes.
Step 4: Move individually into the hide site, being careful not to disturb or cut any vegetation.
Step 5: Once occupied, restrict all movement to less than 45 centimeters (18 inches) above ground.
warnings: Direct entry creates obvious trails leading to your position that trackers can follow.
Any vegetation disturbance around the hide site will reveal your presence.
Movement above 45cm can be spotted by observers from a distance.
